text: Psalm 63
Longing for God

A psalm of David, when \add he\add* was in the wilderness of Judah.\f + \fr Ps 63 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
O God, you \add are\add* my God;
I will seek you diligently.
My soul thirsts for you; my flesh longs for you
\add as\add* in a dry and weary land without water.
Thus I have seen you in the sanctuary,
beholding your strength and glory.
Because your loyal love \add is\add* better than life,
my lips will praise you.
So I will bless you while I live.
I will lift up my ⸤hands⸥\f + \fr 63:4 \ft Hebrew “palms” \f* in your name.
My soul will be satisfied \add as with the\add* best and richest \add food\add*,
and \add with\add* joyful lips my mouth will praise.
When I remember you on my bed,
I meditate on you in \add the\add* night watches.
Because you have been my help,
therefore\f + \fr 63:7 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* in the shadow of your wings I will sing for joy.
My soul clings to\f + \fr 63:8 \ft Or “follows hard after” \f* you;
your right hand upholds me.
But as for them \add who\add* seek my life for ruin,
they will go into the depths of the earth.
They \add who\add* would ⸤deliver him to the sword⸥\f + \fr 63:10 \ft Literally “pour him out to the hands of the sword” \f*
will become a portion for jackals.
However, the king will rejoice in God.
Everyone who swears an oath by him will boast,
because \add the\add* mouth of \add the\add* liars will be stopped.
